title: It's tank meta again
body: Just played an ARAM game where 2 of our tanks spent 3 minutes fisting the 3 other tanks on the other team. Our Talon was less useful than a cannon minion because of this.

replies.body: ARAM is always like that, though.

Why was your talon focusing their tanks? 
Why wasn't he letting your tanks body block for him to reach their carries?

> [{quoted}](name=ZT Xperimentor,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=KF88G7jV,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2017-07-23T21:56:10.327+0000)
>
> Why was your talon focusing their tanks? 
> Why wasn't he letting your tanks body block for him to reach their carries?

There were no carries, they had 3 tanks: Blitzcrank, Maokai, and Nautilus( 4 if you build some armor on Jarvan, which one of our oppenents partly did). Veigar was their only AP and impossible to reach because of his hard cc.

http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2555287189/236297233?tab=overview

Ah that makes more sense, if it was a mundo & galio I'd be worried he was inept. 
If those tanks were paying attention, veiger wouldn't need to use his cc; conversily anivia and karma could split their team forcing a 5v2 or 3, letting talon being a distraction while hecarim wears then down with you. Thing is, their team is all magic damage aside from jarvan, and talon's build is rather questionable; a maw of malmortus would've been better.
Still it was a stacked match against you, arams tend to be decided by one of four things; sudden damage, repeatable crowd control, extreme range, or spamable mobility.

Thing is, their team is all magic damage aside from jarvan, and talon's build is rather questionable; a maw of malmortus would've been better.
> Still it was a stacked match against you, arams tend to be decided by one of four things; sudden damage, repeatable crowd control, extreme range, or spamable mobility.

I believe repeatable crowd control is the most deciding factor. Maw would have certainly helped against Veigar especially but I don't know AD builds that much since I play mostly champions that use AP.
Fair enough, I'd recommend glancing at items you don't normally buy, so you have an idea what you could be fighting against.
